intro: Rumicastrum uncinellum, commonly known as the hooked rumicostem, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its distinctive, hooked spines on its stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh, dry environments it inhabits. Rumicastrum uncinellum is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
